page.title: 15The Feast & Fayre-Horndon
page.content: The Feast and Fayre started in Horndon-on-the-Hill when Edward I granted a Royal Charter to Robert Gifford and his heirs. It was stated that it should be connected with the feast of the patron saints of the Church, the Apostles Peter and Paul. The festivities were revived by the Horndon Society in 1974, having lapsed in the early years of the century. Each year, in June, a different historical period is taken as a theme. The theme this year is the late 12th century when King Richard I was King of England. Many people who attend dress up in costumes of the period. Many activities take place over the weekend including displays of drama by Palmers Sixth Form College, Morris dancing, Maypole and country dancing or drama from the school.
